pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

related.meaning: keinginan sesaat, keisengan, temperamen yang tidak stabil

lessons.japanese: 引き出しの鍵がいたずらされて、書類が一部紛失した。
lessons.indonesian: The lock on my drawer had been tampered with and some of my papers were missing.

lessons.japanese: もし鍵を紛失すれば、私は戸締まりができない。
lessons.indonesian: If I lost my key, I wouldn't be able to lock the door.

lessons.japanese: この手紙は紛失するといけないから、書留にするがよい。
lessons.indonesian: You had better get this letter registered for fear it should be lost.

lessons.japanese: あなたのために紛失した指輪を探してあげましょう。
lessons.indonesian: I will find you your lost ring.

lessons.japanese: 郵便局で物を送ったら郵便局のミスでその品を紛失された。
lessons.indonesian: When the thing was sent into the post office, the goods were lost due to the mistake of the post office.

lessons.japanese: 彼女はハンドバッグを紛失した。
彼女はハンドバッグを買ったが、その翌日に紛失した。
lessons.indonesian: She bought a handbag, but she lost it the next day.

lessons.japanese: 誰が私の紛失した本を見つけてくれたのですか。

lessons.indonesian: Not a little money was lost.
A large sum of money was lost.

lessons.japanese: 私の手荷物は輸送中に紛失した。
lessons.indonesian: My baggage was lost in transit.

lessons.japanese: 私たちはお金の紛失を調査するつもりだ。
lessons.indonesian: We are going to look into the disappearance of the money.

lessons.japanese: 札入れの中身が紛失していた。
lessons.indonesian: The contents of the wallet were missing.

lessons.japanese: 引き出しの鍵がいたずらされて、書類が一部紛失した。
lessons.indonesian: The lock on my drawer had been tampered with and some of my papers were missing.
